course_title: Cell-labelling & Tracking Technologies in MR & Molecular Imaging

learning_outcomes.description: Have knowledge of imaging modalities useful for cell-labelling and tracking in vivo
Demonstrate an understanding of the potential benefits and disadvantages of each molecular imaging modality in application to cell tracking/targeting, particularly in nanomedicine
Demonstrate the ability to apply each modality to a specific cell-targeted application.

Acquire sufficient knowledge to choose the appropriate labelling approach for chelates and conjugates and demonstrate solid knowledge of the application of chelates and conjugates in molecular imaging and nanomedicine.

assessments.due_date: Due dates for responses will be througout the semester and are listed on blackboard
assessments.task_description: Discussion questions will be posted on Blackboard Ultra and in the tutorials for modules 2-6 throughout the semester (5 sets of questions in total). Post your response to the questions on the Blackboard Discussion Board. For each discussion in which you submit a response by the due date, you will receive marks, to a maximum of 10 for the whole semester.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
• There are 15 questions in total.
  • Please allow an uninterrupted 30 minutes to take the quiz. When the time runs out the quiz will automatically be saved and submitted as is. 
  • You are allowed only one attempt at each question.
  • The correct answers will be shown after you complete the quiz.

assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description: Students are required to address a question listed on Blackboard.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Please submit your assignment via Blackboard. Students are permitted to submit a draft prior to final submission.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: The final exam will be an in-person, paper-based exam held on campus. Students enrolled externally, please refer to the course profile for External students for in-person examination arrangements.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
